newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Dead Sea mulls plant in Egypt or China.
newsitem.headline: Dead Sea mulls plant in Egypt or China.

text.p: Israel's Dead Sea Works Ltd is looking into setting up a potassium sulphate and sodium sulphate plant in Egypt or China, the company's managing director Uri Ben Noon said on Wednesday.
The investment in the plant is estimated at $50 million.
The proposed plant would use technology developed by Dead Sea Works, which the company has already tested at a pilot plant in Turkey.
"We're looking at both options and hope to make a decision soon," Ben Noon told Reuters.
Potassium sulphate is used in the manufacture of detergents while sodium sulphate is used in the production of fertilisers.
Dead Sea Works, a subsidiary of Israel Chemicals, would supply the potash and the know-how for the plant.
